meanings.definition: To add something extra to complete or enhance
meanings.sent1: She enjoys supplementing her diet with vitamins.
meanings.sent2: The teacher is supplementing the lesson with visual aids.
meanings.sent3: The chef was caught supplementing the recipe with secret spices.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was like supplementing sunshine to a gloomy day.
meanings.sent5: Supplementing your knowledge with practical experience is valuable.

meanings.definition: Something added to complete or enhance
meanings.sent1: The protein shake is a helpful supplementing for his workouts.
meanings.sent2: She bought a new supplementing for her skincare routine.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected gift was a delightful supplementing to her day.
meanings.sent4: His smile was a supplementing that brightened the room.
meanings.sent5: The extra study materials serve as a useful supplementing for the exam.

meanings.definition: The act of adding something extra to complete or enhance
meanings.sent1: Her supplementing of fresh herbs to the dish made it delicious.
meanings.sent2: The supplementing of new technology improved the efficiency of the process.
meanings.sent3: The supplementing of jokes during the meeting lightened the mood.
meanings.sent4: The supplementing of colors in the painting added depth to the artwork.
meanings.sent5: Effective supplementing of feedback can lead to better performance.
